## Welcome to GLOSSA

**GLOSSA** is an open-source R Shiny application for **modeling marine species distributions** using presence/(pseudo-)absence data and environmental predictors. It is designed to lower technical barriers and make SDM analyses accessible through an interactive interface. GLOSSA guides users through a streamlined SDM workflow, from data upload and preprocessing to model fitting, evaluation, and result exploration.

- **Graphical user interface**: An intuitive interface for fitting SDMs.
- **Flexible modeling**: Fit Bayesian Additive Regression Trees (BART) to estimate species-environment relationships.
- **Support for multiple species**: Run and compare separate models within the same session.
- **Support for forecasting**: Project distributions across time periods or climate scenarios.
- **Uncertainty estimation**: Summarize posterior predictions with point and interval estimates.
- **Model evaluation**: Evaluate performance using cross-validation, including spatial blocks and temporal splits.
- **Reproducible outputs**: Export all results alongside a configuration file to ensure reproducibility.
